isis.stitle: 2 SPEED AXLE SHIFT UNIT: EATON - ELECTRIC SHIFT UNIT - REASSEMBLE

note.para: Use RheoLube 362 lubricant during following assembly procedures. Use of other lube types may cause operational problems under certain low temperature conditions.

step1.para: Lubricate pins. Install pins in the motor housing. Fill motor housing cavity with lubricant ( Figure 10).
Lubricate both sides of the gear washer and gear face that contacts gear washer as shown ( Figure 11).

figure.caption: Figure 11. Gear Washer and Face Lubrication

step1.para: Liberally apply lubricant on gear teeth. Completely fill cavities between teeth ( Figure 12).
Lubricate the shoulder part of the gear shaft. Assemble shaft, gear and washer, then place this assembly in the motor housing.
Connect ground lead wire. Install gear locknut. While holding shaft end with locking pliers, tighten locknut to 65 to 85 in-lbs. (7.3 to 9.6 N•m) ( Figure 13).
After installing gear and shaft assembly, rotate gear COUNTERCLOCKWISE to be sure it does not bind ( Figure 14). Clockwise rotation is prevented by shift unit design.

figure.caption: Figure 14. Gear and Shaft Assembly Rotation

note.para: Use Rheolube 362 lubricant during the following assembly procedures. Use of other lube types may cause operational problems under certain low temperature conditions.

step1.para: Apply a light film of lubricant to the full length of the slider block shaft ( Figure 15). Fill entire slot area of slider block with lubricant (the area which engages gear pin). Also fill the cavity next to the gear with lubricant (cavity adjacent to motor shaft hole).
Rotate gear to position the gear pin at 90° from the slider block shaft centerline ( Figure 16). Install slider block by nesting the block shaft in the recessed pockets in base housing.

note.para: It may be necessary to move the slider block in one direction or the other to engage the gear pin.

step1.para: With housing mating surfaces clean, apply a 1/8" to 3/16" continuous bead of approved gasket compound around the outer edge of the base housing ( Figure 17). Align the dowel pin with hole in motor housing and assemble the two housings.
Install housing capscrews loosely. Make sure that housings are mating properly by moving the slider block from side to side ( Figure 18).
Tighten housing capscrews to 95 to 115 in-Ibs. (10.7 to 13.0 N•m).

note.para: There should be some slider block free play. If block is rigid, loosen capscrews, reposition block and tighten capscrews finger tight. Re-check slider block free play.

step1.para: Apply a 1/8" to 3/16" continuous bead of approved gasket compound on motor base around motor shaft and lead wire ( Figure 19).
Place motor on housing, guiding the lead terminal and wire through the proper opening and placing shaft through motor housing hole.
Install capscrews and tighten to 25 to 30 in-lbs. (2.8 to 3.4 N•m).
Install circuit board washer on top of gear lock nut ( Figure 20).
Connect motor lead wire to circuit board terminal ( Figure 21).
Install circuit board on gear shaft and install locknut ( Figure 22). Tighten locknut to 14 to 16 in-lbs. (1.6 to 1.8 N•m).
Using RTV gasket compound, apply a thin bead on the top edge of the motor housing.
Connect circuit board lead wires to cover terminals ( Figure 23). Carefully push wires back in housing.

figure.caption: Figure 23. Connect Lead Wires To Cover Terminals

note.para: Exert care when repositioning lead wires to prevent smearing or destroying gasket compound.

step1.para: Position cover on motor housing and install capscrews. Tighten cover cap- screws to 25 to 30 in-lbs. (2.8 to 3.4 N•m).

note.para: Before installation, place shift unit in low range. This can be accomplished by connecting chassis wiring harness to shift unit cover and operating control switch (in cab), or apply 12-volt power supply to low range and ground terminals in shift unit cover.

step1.para: Lubricate shift fork in seal area. Install seal and spring assembly on carrier.
Place shift unit on mounting studs, making certain shift unit actuating swivel pin engages the slot in the shift fork. Install flat washers [0.100" (2.54 mm) thick ] and nuts.
Tighten nuts to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 N•m). Connect wiring harness.

note.para: Before installing a rebuilt or replacement shift unit, check fit of shift fork using a "fit-up" card (supplied with unit).
